title: Calories in a Cider Donut
meta_description: Discover calories in a cider donut, including full nutrition breakdown like carbs, fat, protein, and easy tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Standard apple cider donut, fried, ~70 g, coated in cinnamon sugar; no fillings or glazes.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, recipe, size, frying method, and ingredients. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A typical cider donut contains about 250 kcal, with high carbs from the dough and apple cider.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a cider donut?
faqs.a: Approximately 250 kcal for a standard 70 g fried cider donut.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a cider donut?
faqs.a: About 32 g total carbs, including 15 g sugars and 1 g fiber.

faqs.q: Is a cider donut high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, around 12 g fat per donut, mostly from frying oil.

faqs.q: How does baking affect calories in a cider donut?
faqs.a: Baking reduces calories by ~80 kcal compared to frying, to about 170 kcal.

faqs.q: What's the protein content of a cider donut?
faqs.a: Low, at about 3 g per donut, mainly from flour and any added ingredients.
